meanings.definition: The action or process of forming or shaping something in advance.
meanings.sent1: The preformations of the clay pots were done meticulously by the skilled potter.
meanings.sent2: The preformations of the cake were evident in the perfectly shaped layers.
meanings.sent3: The preformations of the snowman were so precise that it looked like a professional sculpture.
meanings.sent4: Her preformations of the dance routine were like a well-rehearsed performance.
meanings.sent5: The preformations of the puzzle pieces made it easy to put them together.

meanings.definition: A previously formed or shaped object or structure.
meanings.sent1: The artist displayed his preformations of sculptures at the gallery.
meanings.sent2: The preformations of the building showed intricate architectural details.
meanings.sent3: The preformations of the sandcastle stood tall until the waves washed it away.
meanings.sent4: The preformations of the tree branches created a beautiful canopy overhead.
meanings.sent5: The preformations of the toy car made it look like a miniature version of a real vehicle.
